meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'typy': having a distinctive or characteristic style or form.
meanings.sent1: The new painting was typier than the others in the gallery.
meanings.sent2: Her handwriting is typier than mine.
meanings.sent3: The typier hat at the party stood out among the rest.
meanings.sent4: The typier clouds in the sky resembled fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent5: The typier music at the concert made everyone dance with joy.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'typy': resembling or characteristic of a particular type.
meanings.sent1: The typier car model was more popular among young drivers.
meanings.sent2: His typier behavior made him easy to recognize in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The typier cupcakes at the bake sale sold out quickly.
meanings.sent4: Her typier dress was like a beautiful flower in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The typier scent of the flowers filled the room with a sweet aroma.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'typy': having a high degree of typiness.
meanings.sent1: The typier font on the poster caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The typier design of the logo made it memorable.
meanings.sent3: The typier shoes she wore to the party were a conversation starter.
meanings.sent4: His typier jokes always made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent5: The typier taste of the dish left a lasting impression on the guests.
